kirstenbosch-national-botanical-garden-1.title: Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden
kirstenbosch-national-botanical-garden-1.description: Kirstenbosch is the name of a famous botanical garden nestled at the foot of Table Mountain in Cape Town.

kruger-park-elephants.title: Kruger Park - Elephants
kruger-park-elephants.description: Kruger National Park is one of the largest game reserves in Africa. Areas of the park were first protected by the government of the South African Republic in 1898, and it became South Africa's first national park in 1926. All the Big Five game animals (lions, leopards, rhinos, elephants and buffalos) are found at Kruger National Park, which has more species of large mammals than any other African game reserve.

kruger-park-elephants-1.title: Kruger Park - Elephants

kruger-park-birds.title: Kruger Park - Birds
kruger-park-birds.description: Out of the 517 species of birds found at Kruger, 253 are residents, 117 non-breeding migrants, and 147 nomads. Some of the larger birds require large territories or are sensitive to habitat degradation. Six of these species, which are by and large restricted to Kruger and other extensive conservation areas, have been assigned to a fanciful grouping called the "Big Six Birds". They are the lappet-faced vulture, martial eagle, saddle-billed stork, kori bustard, ground hornbill and the reclusive Pel's fishing owl, which is localized and seldom seen.

cape-of-good-hope-2.title: Cape of Good Hope
cape-of-good-hope-2.description: The Cape of Good Hope is a rocky headland on the Atlantic coast of the Cape Peninsula, South Africa. The first European to reach the cape was the Portuguese explorer Bartolomeu Dias 12 March in 1488, who named it the "Cape of Storms" (Cabo das Tormentas). It was later renamed by John II of Portugal as "Cape of Good Hope" (Cabo da Boa Esperan√ßa) because of the great optimism engendered by the opening of a sea route to India and the East.

lions-head-1.title: Lion's Head
lions-head-1.description: Lion's Head is a mountain in Cape Town, South Africa, between Table Mountain and Signal Hill. Lion's Head peaks at 669 metres (2,195 ft) above sea level. The peak forms part of a dramatic backdrop to the city of Cape Town and is part of the Table Mountain National Park.

lions-head.title: Lion's Head
lions-head.description: Lion's Head is a mountain in Cape Town, South Africa, between Table Mountain and Signal Hill. Lion's Head peaks at 669 metres (2,195 ft) above sea level. The peak forms part of a dramatic backdrop to the city of Cape Town and is part of the Table Mountain National Park.

university-of-kwazulu-natal-durban-campu.title: University of KwaZulu Natal - Durban Campus

cradle-of-humankind-world-heritage-site.title: Cradle Of Humankind World Heritage Site
cradle-of-humankind-world-heritage-site.description: The Cradle of Humankind is a World Heritage Site first named by UNESCO in 1999, about 50 kilometres northwest of Johannesburg, South Africa in the Gauteng province.

apartheid-museum.title: Apartheid Museum
apartheid-museum.description: The Apartheid Museum is a museum complex in Johannesburg, South Africa dedicated to illustrating apartheid and the 20th century history of South Africa. The structure pictured here is owned by Gold Reef - the Casino Company.

durban-country-club.title: Durban Country Club
durban-country-club.description: Greyville Racecourse (home of the Durban July Handicap) and Durban Country Club and golf course.

iziko-south-african-museum.title: Iziko South African Museum
iziko-south-african-museum.description: The Iziko SA Museum is a South African national museum which located in Cape Town. The museum was founded in 1825, the first in the country. It has been on its present site in the Company's Garden since 1897.

view-from-the-top-of-table-mountain.title: View from the top of Table Mountain
view-from-the-top-of-table-mountain.description: Table Mountain is a flat-topped mountain forming a prominent landmark overlooking the city of Cape Town in South Africa, and is featured in the Flag of Cape Town and other local government insignia.

boschendal-wines-estate.title: Boschendal Wines Estate
boschendal-wines-estate.description: Boschendal (Dutch: wood and dale) is one of the oldest wine estates in South Africa and is located between Franschhoek and Stellenbosch in South Africa's Western Cape.

vrede.title: Vrede
vrede.description: Vrede is a town in the Free State province of South Africa that is the agricultural hub of a 100 km¬≤ region. Maize, wheat, mutton, wool, beef, dairy products and poultry are farmed in the region.

de-grendel.title: De Grendel
de-grendel.description: Sir David de Villiers Graaff, 3rd Baronet (born 3 May 1940), is a South African businessman and owner of De Grendel Wine Estate.

constantia-cape-town.title: Constantia, Cape Town
constantia-cape-town.description: Constantia is an affluent suburb of Cape Town, South Africa, situated about 15 kilometres south of the centre of Cape Town. The Constantia Valley lies to the east of and at the foot of the Constantiaberg mountain.

durban-botanic-gardens.title: Durban Botanic Gardens
durban-botanic-gardens.description: The Durban Botanic Gardens is situated in the City of Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa. It is Durban‚Äôs oldest public institution and Africa's oldest surviving botanic gardens. The gardens cover an area of 15 hectares in a subtropical climate.

mouille-point.title: Mouille Point
mouille-point.description: Mouille Point is an affluent suburb of Cape Town, situated between the V&A Waterfront to the east, Green Point to the south and the Atlantic Ocean to the north and west.

addo-elephant-national-park.title: Addo Elephant National Park
addo-elephant-national-park.description: Addo Elephant National Park is a diverse wildlife conservation park situated close to Port Elizabeth in South Africa and is one of the country's 19 national parks.

companys-garden.title: Company's Garden
companys-garden.description: The Company's Garden is a park and heritage site located in central Cape Town. The garden was originally created in the 1650s by the region's first European settlers and provided fertile ground to grow fresh produce to replenish ships rounding the Cape.

ellis-park-stadium.title: Ellis Park Stadium
ellis-park-stadium.description: Ellis Park Stadium is a rugby union and association football stadium in the city of Johannesburg, Gauteng Province, South Africa. It hosted the final of the 1995 Rugby World Cup, which was won by the country's national team, the Springboks.

golden-mile-durban.title: Golden Mile, Durban
golden-mile-durban.description: The Golden Mile (or, colloquially, "The Mile") is the popular stretch of beachfront in the city of Durban, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa, including the promenade that runs along with it.

dobsonville-stadium.title: Dobsonville Stadium
dobsonville-stadium.description: Dobsonville Stadium, commercially known as the Volkswagen Dobsonville Stadium, is a multi-purpose stadium in Soweto, a suburb of Johannesburg, South Africa. It is mostly used for football matches, but is also equipped with an athletics track.

parent.title: South Africa: The Mzansi Experience
parent.description: Explore the natural beauty of South Africa including iconic destinations such as Kruger National Park, Table Mountain, and Cape of Good Hope. Go on safari and view spectacular wildlife in Kruger National Park. Hike along the top of Table Mountain and take in the magnificent views of the bay and beaches below. Then, walk along the sand of Cape Town‚Äôs beautiful beaches.
